item.title: Apache HTTP server
item.description: What is it? Apache is a popular Open-source web server. Projects Deprecation I would favour using Nginx over the Apache HTTP server. Nginx is less verbose, more modern and easier to work with.

item.title: BabelJS
item.description: What is it? BabelJS is a tool that transpiles ES2015 to ES5 for cross-browser compatibility. With this, you can use bleeding-edge language features (with the correct plugins) and still support all modern browsers.

item.title: Prerender
item.description: What is it? Prerender generates static HTML for client-side single page applications to make them accessible to web crawlers. Projects Deprecation Most modern JavaScript frameworks and libraries use isomorphic rendering, where content is rendered on the server as well as the client. This negates the need for something like Prerender.

item.title: Sublime Text
item.description: What is it? Sublime text is a lightweight modular text editor. Projects Deprecation While useful as a scratchpad for ideas, WebStorm is far more powerful and has excellent integration for JavaScript based applications.

item.title: WebPack
item.description: What is it? WebPack is a bundling tool to manage static assets, styles and scripts. It is used to bundle these depending on the environment you are working in, and supports transpilation of JavaScript and CSS assets. With BabelJS you to use modern Javascript features and transpiles them to ES5 to run in environments where those features might not yet be supported.
